strategy: Use LightGBM with these settings: num_boost_round=600, learning_rate=0.04, max_depth=8. For preprocessing, fill numeric NaN values with the median and use LightGBM's categorical feature handling by specifying the categorical features parameter. Ensure all categorical features are cast to string type before training.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Ensure categorical columns are string type and handle NaN
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)

# Create LightGBM dataset with explicit categorical feature specification
train_data = lgb.Dataset(X_train, label=y_train, categorical_feature=['Sex', 'Embarked'])

# Train model with refined hyperparameters
params = {
    'objective': 'binary',
    'metric': 'auc',
    'num_boost_round': 600,
    'learning_rate': 0.04,
    'max_depth': 8,
    'verbosity': -1
}

model = lgb.train(params, train_data)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': (y_pred > 0.5).astype(int)
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Ensure categorical columns are string type and handle NaN
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)

# Convert all columns to ensure proper types for LightGBM
X_train = X_train.astype({col: 'str' for col in categorical_columns if col in X_train.columns})
X_test = X_test.astype({col: 'str' for col in categorical_columns if col in X_test.columns})

# Create LightGBM dataset with explicit categorical feature specification
train_data = lgb.Dataset(X_train, label=y_train, categorical_feature=['Sex', 'Embarked'])

# Train model with refined hyperparameters
params = {
    'objective': 'binary',
    'metric': 'auc',
    'num_boost_round': 600,
    'learning_rate': 0.04,
    'max_depth': 8,
    'verbosity': -1
}

model = lgb.train(params, train_data)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': (y_pred > 0.5).astype(int)
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Ensure categorical columns are string type and handle NaN
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)

# Convert to numeric types for LightGBM compatibility by dropping non-numeric categorical features
# LightGBM can handle strings via categorical_feature, so we keep the string columns
# But ensure no other dtypes are problematic

# Create LightGBM dataset with explicit categorical feature specification
train_data = lgb.Dataset(X_train, label=y_train, categorical_feature=['Sex', 'Embarked'])

# Train model with refined hyperparameters
params = {
    'objective': 'binary',
    'metric': 'auc',
    'num_boost_round': 600,
    'learning_rate': 0.04,
    'max_depth': 8,
    'verbosity': -1
}

# Create submission

    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': (y_pred > 0.5).astype(int)

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Ensure categorical columns are string type and handle NaN
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)

# LightGBM supports string categorical features directly; we just need to specify them
# Create LightGBM dataset with explicit categorical feature specification
train_data = lgb.Dataset(X_train, label=y_train, categorical_feature=['Sex', 'Embarked'])

# Train model with refined hyperparameters
params = {
    'objective': 'binary',
    'metric': 'auc',
    'num_boost_round': 600,
    'learning_rate': 0.04,
    'max_depth': 8,
    'verbosity': -1
}

model = lgb.train(params, train_data)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': (y_pred > 0.5).astype(int)
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Ensure categorical columns are string type and handle NaN
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)

# Drop non-essential categorical features that are too high cardinality or noisy
# Keep only Sex and Embarked as categorical features for LightGBM
# Name, Ticket, Cabin are dropped or transformed to reduce complexity

# Create LightGBM dataset with explicit categorical feature specification
train_data = lgb.Dataset(X_train, label=y_train, categorical_feature=['Sex', 'Embarked'])

# Train model with refined hyperparameters
params = {
    'objective': 'binary',
    'metric': 'auc',
    'num_boost_round': 600,
    'learning_rate': 0.04,
    'max_depth': 8,
    'verbosity': -1
}

model = lgb.train(params, train_data)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': (y_pred > 0.5).astype(int)
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Convert categorical columns to string and handle NaN
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)

# LightGBM can handle string categorical features when explicitly specified
# We only specify Sex and Embarked as categorical features in the model
# The rest are treated as string features, but only Sex and Embarked are used in categorical_feature

# Create dataset with proper categorical feature specification
train_data = lgb.Dataset(X_train, label=y_train, categorical_feature=['Sex', 'Embarked'])

# Train model with refined hyperparameters
params = {
    'objective': 'binary',
    'metric': 'auc',
    'num_boost_round': 600,
    'learning_rate': 0.04,
    'max_depth': 8,
    'verbosity': -1
}

model = lgb.train(params, train_data)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': (y_pred > 0.5).astype(int)
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = ['Age', 'Fare']
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Convert categorical columns to string and handle NaN
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin']
for col in categorical_columns:
    if col in X_train.columns:
        X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)
        X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna('Unknown').astype(str)

# Ensure only Sex and Embarked are specified as categorical in the model
# LightGBM handles string features automatically when categorical_feature is specified

# Create dataset with categorical feature specification
train_data = lgb.Dataset(X_train, label=y_train, categorical_feature=['Sex', 'Embarked'])

# Train model with refined hyperparameters
params = {
    'objective': 'binary',
    'metric': 'auc',
    'num_boost_round': 600,
    'learning_rate': 0.04,
    'max_depth': 8,
    'verbosity': -1
}

model = lgb.train(params, train_data)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': (y_pred > 0.5).astype(int)
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
